title: Human Anatomy and Physiology Content Statements: Grades 9-12
subject: Science (2018-)

DE280C26BB9448B693D836210A412BEE.description: Compare the processes of oogenesis and spermatogenesis.

D42137AA3BA1470D9EC8EAFFD22EBFA3.description: Explain the pathway of a gamete through each reproductive system.

60CD7A08AEE44C74ACE051B34B412413.description: Identify the structures of the female reproductive system and the functions of each structure.

6E0F8266FB7A4F3CBF24BCDA9340B1E1.description: Identify the structures of the male reproductive system and the functions of each structure.

A9C375C945714A3794AA898B21ECE537.description: Design a poster or similar graphic to inform peers of the global, human population over the last 5,000 years.

43A6B83E55B6489CB408095EAB2CA9E2.description: Interpret information from a case study to discuss the misconception that all menstrual cycles last 28 days.

4605C36736AC4AF3BC825BD5BB4396DF.description: Display the current global distribution of monotreme, marsupial and placental mammals. Propose one or more hypotheses to explain these observed distribution patterns.

7537088435EC4FCCA38F922E7D8290DB.description: Develop a visual graphic with a timeline indicating the evolution of reproductive physiology in mammals from egg laying monotremes, marsupials and then placental mammals.

25F3636CE9804FD087AD487FCE35B5B2.description: Examine how environmental variables can impact sea urchin fertilization.

15073FB94ABA4AE69781DC20B4BE848E.description: Design an artificial womb (ectogenesis) that could support embryonic life.

91100D77E19541B6926543407A1AC34A.description: Describe the gross and histological structure of the urinary bladder. Relate the structure of the urinary bladder to its function.

3B400312E784456BA9B4348523884CDE.description: Identify the impacts of drinking too much water (i.e., hyperhydration).

1B4C8935AD9A4F708ECA12E0D70C7769.description: Explain how molecules/hormones influence the body's hydration status.

57413C63B6B84757AF8E71784AF783AF.description: Illustrate or describe the roles of osmosis and diffusion in the process of urine formation.

17EBD6F5DEF1464A89AB3FD5ABF856FB.description: Describe the process by which the body eliminates excess fluids.

44A8A8E54E854AE697EF3D715805F354.description: Describe the basic physiological processes accomplished by the nephron (filtration, reabsorption, secretion).

C9DED5D1FAC24222B8A88341FAF70FC1.description: Trace the formation of urine through the processes of osmosis and diffusion.

B31788EB417B45DAAF74C252D8C7866B.description: Kangaroo rats live in the Mojave Desert of the U.S. Predict how the relative dimensions of their nephrons compare with those of humans. Justify the prediction.

EC95D7F942C74AFEABA998EB3E83DE14.description: Explain what lab values you would expect in various patient scenarios (e.g., infection, dehydration).

6C12CBC812624FE88C731051DA3D70AF.description: Illustrate or describe the roles of osmosis and diffusion in the process of urine formation.

A68E7215767E4F3A82FCA8122D48DC0C.description: Compare the functions of current hemodialysis machines with the actual kidneys.

5EEC31FC8B0B4D65B0C48EED758BE5BF.description: Create a pamphlet that explains the impact of diet on blood chemistry and how that affects kidney function, especially in those on dialysis.

F3183526D9914883B177571C09228BF5.description: Interpret lab values to determine what ions/proteins need to be altered during dialysis.

6C78DE61A6D046DC8FB781C1B33569DD.description: Explain the relationship between the renal system and other organ systems (e.g., vascular). Include complications of renal failure.

E550A3FE40F44142A47E7603469A7EE8.description: Illustrate filtration, secretion and reabsorption of ions/molecules in the kidney.

0D02D7436A37453BB6A12C9930964148.description: Match representative urine lab values (concentrations) with mock patient scenarios for a condition (e.g., high ADH, dehydration, excess coffee, urinary tract infection, diuretics). Create a treatment plan for the patient.

AD17326541EF4D1F89E9AC4A615153AC.description: Design a model using dialysis tubing and some common solute to demonstrate the movement of wastes from interstitial fluid to the renal tube.

209EEC15A64A458D9AF83D1280C46F56.description: Design a device that serves as a "mini dialysis" machine to be used in patients with renal failure. List and discuss the limitations.

B91D26EC7DAE4A29B916AE863606F6CF.description: Explain how to determine breathing rate and depth.

EC057FD4EF5E49E599F03C4E9E092476.description: Differentiate between tidal volume and breathing rate.

15F70EC44D1C4148BEAEC133FAB4FA7F.description: Explain the physiological effects and damages caused by PM 2.5 particles generated by the combustion of fossil fuels.

FE86A50B94B5405680DCDB686016EE5B.description: Name muscles used for inspiration and expiration.

B4BD8314D45041CCA21B517125353C70.description: Explain what factors alter respiratory volumes.

F65686A0290E47F3BABAAEDD5D4E815B.description: Explain how the structure in each portion of the respiratory tree supports its function.

AE641B321D934802B1B0FE009E73BCA4.description: Identify sections of the respiratory tree by histological slides/images.

5D767A5EA2164DB086103E8038345992.description: Create a poster or other graphic comparing the size of PM 2.5 particles generated by combustion of fossil fuels to the size of particles that can be diffused by the surfaces of the respiratory system (including the size of red blood cells).

7BBD46A318F443E3A027F5B3E125C50F.description: Explore asthma rates, pollution levels and ozone levels, globally.

295DEEBDF20349958BAB4EBFC6CBD0FC.description: Interpret spirometry data and match it to the appropriate "patients"; normal, asthmatic, smoker, athlete. Provide evidence to support your claim.

D378E4DC1FB047E28C33EAFDF0BA48B6.description: Explain mammalian (including human) respiration by comparing it to the respiratory anatomy and physiology of the other major vertebrate groups (e.g., cephalochordates/urochordates, fish, amphibians, amniotes).

DD5C600A7B5A4949A4342E379CDF5F3F.description: Perform an investigation to compare pre- and post- exercise data (e.g., breathing rate, depth, tidal volume).

1026D441A6F54731BC511C0F92FD4319.description: Investigate local air quality and asthma or other pulmonary disease rates. Formulate an argument for how the air quality in an area impacts local respiratory health.

EAD1AEE54A744E8DA97685A35AE809BE.description: Investigate factors which alter respiratory volumes. Compare breathing in obstructive and restrictive diseases (e.g., simulate obstructive disease by wrapping a belt around the chest and tightening appropriately, simulate restrictive disease by pursing lips around a straw). Collect data on respiratory volumes during obstructive and restrictive respiratory disorders (e.g., use a tape measure to measure the thoracic cavity as an estimate of volume).

CA2344CDB5A149D8B360A4CC2884198C.description: Design a model to show how cold/flu impacts respiratory function. Use the model to investigate how various remedies alleviate symptoms.

A890D01FF512456BAA45E7F18876B17E.description: Design a device to improve the respiratory function in athletes.

B59EAD47C8334A388B1544B5AEDBC851.description: Determine the design specifications of a face mask to filter fine particulate matter (PM 2.5 particles) resulting from the combustion of fossil fuels.

95B214C845F34CDDA0C89B87B58405DA.description: Design an action plan to improve the air quality in an area with low air quality (e.g., construction dust in a building).

B5659149D470405181FBCC8268C85277.description: Identify tissue and cell types in digestive and accessory organs using microscopes, slides, micrographs, models or illustrations.

22ACCF1952C547D8A6EA0E749E062D0B.description: Identify the regions of the stomach and their functions.

8CF477CCD44340A09CA3ED0416DAD4ED.description: Explain the role of a specific enzyme in the digestive process. Include where it is produced, where it enters the alimentary canal, the pH range in which it works best, the types of molecules it chemically digests and what products the chemical breakdown forms.

731DAE5F626D42439354E80418E87DB2.description: Describe the structure and function of accessory digestive organs.

5BE1A1FDD23747ED89216B8EFBC20CD3.description: Trace food from the mouth to the anus and describe what happens in each region.

EAFF3403ADD34335A1B9A6652C43402A.description: Prepare a presentation on the importance of symbiotic colonic bacteria.

781FD4543C69437D88BE7BC8ADC74342.description: Explain how hydrochloric acid (HCl) in the stomach aids in digestion and provides protection from pathogens.

069B7F6D9DFE421EAB466F49BB6C258D.description: Explain how bariatric surgery impacts the digestive system.

A4059DC3B0404582BD5120FAFAAB2103.description: Journal daily food choices and relate it to the current USDA Choose My Plate recommendations.

9041267268C846CE9A13BF0AB266F776.description: Assess the claim that probiotic foods are healthy. Provide evidence to support or refute this claim.

02483A98D5F1481CBBEFA7BD402064D8.description: Compare the efficiency of human digestion and ruminant digestion.

EE236BF0FDF14004A289D816D729C3CB.description: Design models of mechanical and chemical digestion using varied materials.

2E6204F281824AA1AAFD8677764031DA.description: Investigate the relative lengths of the alimentary canal of various vertebrates with differing diets. Propose hypotheses to explain the relationship between relative length and diet.

A3F492C6E3394DC9949384827A27D159.description: Research global geographic variation in the prevalence of lactase persistence. Relate this geographic variation in the ability to chemically digest milk sugar to the cultural history of dairy livestock domestication. Consider the timeframe of microevolutionary changes between human populations.

B2D80B9128AB464A97A1492131773C00.description: Explore the types of bariatric surgeries and compare their safety and effectiveness to determine whether this is an effective weight-loss solution. Explain the advantages and disadvantages.

2E89871676BD41598797CDCAC312BA7C.description: Propose a procedure as a potential cure for cirrhosis or ulcers using tissue engineering techniques.

90E08A583242436A8A999DAF4B2A8546.description: Propose a redesign of an alimentary canal segment and/or accessory digestive organ.

016123ABD4FD4D99800359ECDFE5B472.description: Describe the mechanisms of autoimmune responses.

6AAA50D5B8DF4DFBBF3E8296D06549C5.description: Create a flowchart to demonstrate the circulation of lymph throughout the body.

221E167EF50344F38C21A61289FAF0AA.description: Identify and describe the structures and functions of the lymphatic system.

7BFDC7F140834F82842A0918F221C176.description: Describe the uses for Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA).

35E41D1E198847D6B5AD8E0646C4BCF8.description: Explain how the immune system works.

F5F3699BC6CF44D993724BBD30B2863F.description: Create labeled illustrations or models of the cells of the immune system.

A933FD713A4843AC940C61E7E57AFD2B.description: Design a model to demonstrate the spread of a pathogen throughout a population.

EAC3CBAC18F14647AE775EB4AC2A7D73.description: Critique the effectiveness of tonsil removal on infection rates.

723DDC156AF4493180604A02535A9FC7.description: Create a community education campaign to increase awareness about the transmission of insect-transmitted diseases, their causes and prevention.

434883CB361E46FD892F13E75292916A.description: Compare the treatment of bacterial and viral infections. Include concepts of nonspecific and specific resistance.

0A4145E3B14E4264827C4728A6AE993F.description: Create a public service announcement highlighting the benefits of vaccinations for children, including risks to the population at large.

DAF3157F6F114CC483A7A26842E42D04.description: Design an experiment to test the effectiveness of antibacterial products.

1059DAA2440A4628A9DD0BB9B3BB34F6.description: Explain how antibiotic resistance arises in a microbial population using insights from an understanding of evolution through natural selection.

1F84A20158BC436DB5E03F80CA126ACF.description: Identify homeostatic imbalances of the cardiovascular system.

5CC9FC9036EC4315B06E456ABF1D9B14.description: Describe the features of an electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG) used to identify homeostatic imbalances.

154C6F50EFBC4C09928C3E9B96632533.description: Match electrocardiogram (ECG/EKG) waves to events in the cardiac cycle.

A773AFE25CC94B3684F5B286D12F517E.description: Explain the relationship between heart rate, volume and cardiac output.

7C162F85D796494391DD834D7CECEC18.description: Identify the components of cardiac output.

FFEE80356343418384BB28192829A1DA.description: Identify the cells and tissues of the cardiovascular system.

854425062D5D49AA840E388492710C6F.description: Identify the functions of the cardiovascular system.

44619B5D9A2247AE8D2F3709808A92D4.description: Create labeled illustrations or models to describe the pathway of blood through the pulmonary and systemic circuits.

CAE05145783A43268E57358DCC1F20E6.description: Create labeled illustrations or models to describe the pathway of blood through the valves, chambers and major vessels of the heart.

47DD0A5041E44CD8A4C49EAFE8363355.description: Create labeled illustrations or models of congenital cardiovascular defects and explain how they disrupt normal cardiac function.

F393C7611FA1401E91A9DFF5AEFD1AE5.description: Diagnose an individual by analyzing an electrocardiogram.

C94CA4F166C847398F01D78D23BC1204.description: Describe how microgravity can be applied on Earth to treat or prevent circulatory diseases.

D98045F0FCE74E139D8493BCD9E8787C.description: Create labeled illustrations, models, or written descriptions to differentiate between arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules and veins in terms of structure and function.

CADAE30D4D53451687986C668332E859.description: Describe the relationship between the structure and specialized function of cardiac muscle cells.

8EA28CF692A246BEB1666F560DC49292.description: Based on labeled illustrations, explain the components needed for an artificial heart and/or its components.

0D1088B386E048CA9E2B306705984EB4.description: Diagnose homeostatic imbalances by analyzing signs and symptoms, laboratory data, ECG/EKGs and imaging studies. Create an evidence-based treatment plan.

B6C75A057D574642A510523658B5F31E.description: Manipulate and measure cardiac output to investigate the relationship between heart rate, volume and cardiac output.

E04F235B9F81435984251D3E779FB9EB.description: Dissect various vertebrate hearts to compare mammalian hearts with those of birds (4-chambered), amphibians (3-chambered) and fish (2-chambered). Trace the flow of blood through the vessels, valves, and chambers of the heart and explore the role the organ plays in the propulsion of blood through the pulmonary and systemic circuits. Use findings to develop an understanding of the function of the 4-chambered heart to support endothermic organisms.

BF6C03E6E2614558A15B0CB9A9CA14C3.description: Investigate the structures and function of the human heart by dissecting a sheep heart, which is similar in structure and function. Trace the flow of blood through the vessels, valves, and chambers of the heart and explore the role the organ plays in the propulsion of blood through the pulmonary and systemic circuits.

CA5D8C5E0B9B475A98D52413E7C89F2F.description: Design a device to clear an occluded artery.

9A2C0448DB4D4A03B5D23465D2483745.description: Analyze data to explain why long-term exposure to microgravity can be dangerous to the cardiovascular system. Propose counter-measures to minimize effects of microgravity.

315AC20981E64114AE26F18FADD1219D.description: Critique available artificial heart and valve products.

C529ACD14C104C3BB54C7B77E98676E1.description: Create a labeled illustration or model of blood to explain the relationship between antigens, antibodies and blood type (e.g., ABO/Rh).

74C3694745914CCC9801E9DB11FB4783.description: Use Punnett squares to explain the inheritance of blood types.

A8ED36F4A0604668B3850578AF6690E8.description: Construct a pedigree of a family history and create a genetic counseling plan to advise the patient and family.

AC1070D402A549AEB0939520CAD97A57.description: Diagnose homeostatic imbalances (e.g., anemia, sickle-cell anemia, leukemia, sepsis) by analyzing laboratory data (e.g., blood sample, patient symptoms, family history).

613697092CD242B5BD61DA010F622E2C.description: Prepare blood transfusion guidelines that a medical assistant can use to understand which patients can receive which type(s) of blood and why blood typing is important for blood transfusions. Include the concepts of "universal donor" and "universal recipient".

C4284E0451C64E0B8791062A194A269E.description: Create a global distribution map of the frequency of the ABO blood groups among native, human populations.

E0EF9B99C12541D9B6A3FE11AF1E16C4.description: Investigate the process of agglutination and describe its consequences.

EEF58506D0CC408F98C81828FF34E2CC.description: Compare the original distribution of sickle-cell anemia in human populations with the global distribution of malaria. Propose one or more hypotheses to explain the distributions and make predictions based on your hypotheses.

14FBFA7982AE49D69F05485D6F214721.description: Propose one or more hypotheses to explain the global distribution of the ABO blood groups in humans.

7910EF941BC7449D84B896B6D7B76DAA.description: Design a process to identify unknown blood types to determine transfusion compatibility or paternity.

FC1B5CB7F70149DA983B597AD4A9346F.description: Draw examples of negative and positive feedback loops. Predict the effect of changes in hormone levels.

3CF9EC39A1414E1A8069005ABD2A17D4.description: Research and prepare a poster for peers identifying where they are exposed to environmental endocrine disruptors in their daily lives.

C4A37A141B3F4D5495A7BB146EDF4288.description: Analyze patient data to diagnose a hormone imbalance and provide suggestions for treatment.

8D91E703EF6E49B789114D0655D2CCBC.description: Explain how environmental endocrine disruptors can lead to an increase in the incidence rate of breast cancer in women in developed but not in developing countries.

66A8412865574ADA9DEDD2D2B80C77A0.description: Propose one or more technological or engineering solution(s) to control broad-leafed "weeds" without using potential environmental endocrine disruptors.

D2B281184FBD4323A88F9FCB1780FCA4.description: Critique the medical devices used by diabetics to monitor and treat blood sugar and propose solutions to address any identified flaws.

5A7803BF4ED74FEEAC83CEF69D682B0A.description: Use models, illustrations or slides to identify the anatomical structures related to taste and smell (e.g., taste buds, gustatory cells, papillae, cilia).

E1CE5B8B3AC24012870175C7F35D9D48.description: Describe sensorineural and conductive hearing pathways.

F360DB2145144ABA84E642CD7305CCE7.description: Listen to different tones and identify patterns of hearing ability.

009C11AD100D4836A442DDDB06A1B2EA.description: Use models or illustrations to identify the main structures in the inner, outer, and middle ear.

3C54EC4CDFE54A1FB3946E4FD506DA9B.description: Use microscopes, micrographs, models or illustrations to identify the main structures of the eye, and their functions.

4BD9A1311D4346DA8411DC4803592F23.description: Trace the pathway of light through the eye.

F614CC9038364C9C91DCBBFDE64C2D7D.description: Explain how chemoreceptor function is blocked by a chemical such as miraculin or by Gymnema sylvestre tea.

8FC8C0906F684C47B41075733C129181.description: Investigate a specific neurological effect of aging and explain how this leads to a homeostatic imbalance (e.g., tinnitus).

F302164325284BB49B51147255A3AE6C.description: Explain how the inner ear maintains equilibrium and balance.

76BE0B77A0EB4D1095A9CFB8E47B5288.description: Compare the structure of the vertebrate eye and the molluscan eye. Design a poster using physiological differences between the vertebrate eye and the molluscan eye to explain why mollusks will never suffer the homeostatic imbalance of detached retina.

0E881BF3AFEE4725A830090D3A900EF8.description: Investigate a specific neurological effect of aging and explain how this leads to a homeostatic imbalance (e.g., glaucoma, hyperopic).

9E7B5CCB8E834AE99ECEF74EDCE8554D.description: Examine binocular vision by performing various eye tests. Identify common defects of the eye (e.g., astigmatism, color blindness) and their common treatments.

20EEE9AF122B474AB575495399947E78.description: Propose one or more hypotheses to explain why a dog's sense of smell is much more sensitive than a human's.

6F715007B23D47E98773E12C879AEC74.description: Design and carry out an investigation to determine how smell and taste are related in the body and how sensory messages to the brain contribute to flavor perception.

9294684190D7498EAA00FDD6B32C21CA.description: Examine the evolutionary origin of the bones involved in hearing in mammals from the earliest chordates.

C5568ED6F249424481856C26A0E1571D.description: Propose one or more evolutionary hypotheses to explain the differences and similarities in the structure and function of vertebrate eyes and molluscan eyes.

29D26387DFEF4968973AF9A610667758.description: Propose hypotheses for how the vertebrate eye first appeared in a common ancestor as a simple organ or clump of cells that detected light and the direction from which it came. Explain the possible adaptive significance of this photosensitivity.

46713ECE52B24C609D67B95420DE6D17.description: Use the mechanism by which bats capture prey in darkness to design an assistive technology for visual impairment.

B20DC46BE8F54E03A807B947B32BF2C5.description: Design a device to direct whales from areas of danger (e.g. the site of a major underwater oil well failure).

D4FAE56060F5407EA6C77FCA3D4D6E63.description: Choose a disease causing a homeostatic imbalance to the sense of hearing. Modify a sound file to illustrate the effects of the damage and suggest possible medical devices that could alleviate the symptoms.

965FE574057F411F94EA85F4BFD342A6.description: Choose a disease causing a homeostatic imbalance to vision. Use a picture as a control, and modify the picture to show how the picture would be seen by an individual with the chosen visual disease. Design a possible medical device that could alleviate the symptom.

9AA7FFB8F5D447D99F076D4C4CB4CA18.description: Use graphs of membrane potential vs. time; distinguish between depolarization, repolarization and hyperpolarization.

ECD4992C02A94F51ABF11496C7666A5B.description: Use microscopes, micrographs, models or illustrations to identify the main structures of a nerve.

FA912279A6BD47B3B4FB2FE7AB9872F0.description: Use microscopes, micrographs, models or illustrations to identify the main structures of the spinal cord.

E438B3A8A57B4B9BA60CE486F9C5D8CF.description: Create labeled illustrations or models of the human brain that include structure and function.

DFBE31C0ACAF446DB2CEE15F8173D487.description: List the functions of the cerebrum, cerebellum and brainstem.

4207EFAF54A6423DBD66DD46A2041613.description: Use microscopes, micrographs, models or illustrations to identify the main structures of the brain.

29A127024EE54BB68AB033A74F0C666A.description: Using microscopes, micrographs, models or illustrations, identify the cells of the nervous tissue.

2F2964E035834CD7B8B31263D27ABF50.description: Identify the main structures and functions of the central nervous system and the peripheral nervous system.

BCCE618ED5EF471D8B601573E23D4D0A.description: Create a model of action potential propagation and/or neurotransmitter function.

B171F2D74D3B4D4091F8C380A01D496F.description: Describe how opioids interfere with chemical communication in the brain. Predict how a change in membrane potential would impact action potential propagation in an axon.

DF03E2E2FBEC46AE8F16E996E2A92787.description: Explain the symptoms of a chosen neurologic disorder based upon the physiology of the disorder.

6216715CEF9E445EA61B2A0E289C4168.description: Explain how the density of nerve endings in different body areas and the ability of nerves to adapt to stimuli relate to human physiology.

247673ED22114AB488E4E2AFC2524A29.description: Differentiate between spinal and cranial nerves

BE0373D9AB184CCC87DE0D868FEF0472.description: Measure reaction and reflex times and explain the differences in your recorded data.

980B5A6FCBA74D2EA0F6E82136506692.description: Compare the structure of another vertebrate brain (e.g., sheep) to the human brain.

4E7D3D0E049B4992879DE5ECEEBE8B2B.description: Determine if the structure and function of the nervous system are similar to the operating system of a computer.

87B61B3BB14F49D295C465ED7EB38636.description: Determine the validity of left brain/right brain dominance.

539D38EE21924A9C8A5EEDF57398F97A.description: Correlate the relationship between a brain injury occurring in a specific region and the expressed symptoms.

8858A4376DB54E3BBD779E750D1E8B10.description: Relate the development of the brain to decision-making skills.

FF7303F65A6549A48B331D38260AF8BD.description: Predict the outcome of tumor growth in different regions of the brain.

5AAE9CEC2D11461BB274907B405FBF8B.description: Critique the current treatment(s) available for a neurological disease (e.g., Parkinson's, MS, Huntington's).

2EA9F64AB7994C36B0B54323D1F1CE1D.description: Construct a 3D model of a neuron that can be used to illustrate anatomy, action potential propagation, simple nerve pathways (reflex arc) and neurotransmitter function.

F960DE3D2CCF4324965CF15F57CEC0E9.description: Evaluate scientific claims for and against the use of environmental toxins/neurotoxins (e.g., lead, mercury, radon). Provide peer-reviewed scientific evidence to support your claims.

FE130640003D4B67BB33DFB6D345E962.description: Compare the structures and functions of the central nervous system with the structures and functions of the peripheral nervous system.

8D0B51780FB74F39A2FF1C60857C5B9A.description: Design and implement an investigation to measure the effect of a depressant or stimulant on a model organism's nervous system (e.g., C. elegans, Daphnia).

E0ABED77E932424197EBACB2D925CA90.description: Design an investigation to compare reaction times and reflex times.

C9A05813F40B4C8A9BB6C526F15578C0.description: Explore some of the difficulties of investigating brain function and critique the limitations in treating damage and disease in the brain and other parts of the nervous system.

45F1FCAB11024E9EA22FC306C7BE5485.description: Design and implement an investigation to measure muscular response to stimuli.

509B0D79AB0B48C29A8B26B52CDF5FB2.description: Design a prototype of a new medical device for an amputee, including the transfer of electrical impulses to neurons.

8AF4F6BC858D442896392D88BC3744CD.description: Use correlations of symptoms caused by brain injuries to critique personal protective equipment (e.g., bicycle helmet, hard hats) and suggest modifications to improve their design.

D02E37EB6D5D4D45B2DF4C48B9A1F8D8.description: High school athletes are reported to be more susceptible to brain damage than their peers. Use scientific evidence to support or refute this claim. If this claim is accurate, suggest a possible way to reduce Chronic Traumatic Encephalopathy (CTE) injuries in high school athletes.

C4193334071B4777B1A63E5765A63F94.description: Examine the basic design of artificial limbs that integrate with the nervous system to provide the recipient control of the device.

0FE54177CBAF43EBB7106C0232FBC1AA.description: Identify common muscle disorders and give common symptoms and treatments.

5DBB25AC34FD4519989D474E739D3C37.description: Research anabolic steroids, their effects on the body, medical applications and risk factors of their use.

EBEC3749F8AB4CE088925780F5010C40.description: Define and describe the types of connective tissue.

64AE724F4D264DE6AEF5D2649AAF6A90.description: Use microscopes, micrographs, models or illustrations to identify muscle tissue types.

6B38FA22A66747BAA54075B9DA85E232.description: Provide an example of muscle fatigue and describe the physiology behind it.

2CB695333CEF4EBE9B03A6E1B57D2DCB.description: Create a product which describes symptoms, treatments and prognosis for varying muscle disorders. Develop a plan to reduce risks and prevent muscle atrophy associated with the disorder.

2FF82F85738E4B32B9B337806F2DA095.description: Create a presentation to inform the public about the risks of anabolic steroid abuse.

0BE791F3F0884A7799D23D4AC1D4791C.description: Research and present findings over the uses for steroids, risks of use and alternative treatment options.

46E09FA1140340D284F3FA0C99314E46.description: Build a model using household items to demonstrate the steps of the sliding filament theory.

63E1A3D5875F4B87BFEA481D3D69BE89.description: Create a presentation describing and differentiating between muscle tissue types.

427C15A245124605B0DFDF25DCE76DF7.description: Explore muscle fatigue in relationship to handedness, gender, height and other factors.

E6CAEAFAE16048D0AA630CDB2176A99F.description: Choose opposing major muscle groups and design an investigation to compare contraction length and/or force.

3E370685C9A94E0FB302B4076E14EE4E.description: Design, plan, and conduct an investigation on muscle fatigue using basic exercise equipment (e.g., tennis ball, clothespin, textbook). Collect data and analyze.

98197B670519488A90F7725C8C413E43.description: Design and construct an artificial hand from common household items where the fingers flex and extend to perform a task.

1F7BAEDC6F90428297D1DCCDF4AA3287.description: Identify the movement involved in moving specified joints.

84EF3C21E473403EA67F00184ED6756E.description: List and describe factors that affect bone density.

A4B89F10002F48899EA801B13A9145B6.description: Create an illustration of different stages of bone development and destruction, including fracture repair.

61123F98EA144ADD84322D0146FBC7FF.description: Identify, label and describe the types of bones using graphics, images, X-ray images or lab bone specimens.

C606468235084C968E4A9231EFF3ADDF.description: Use models or illustrations to identify and name bones and important bony features of the human skeleton.

E8168665C11C4B9DA8BE9137E461C399.description: Create an illustration of a long bone and label all structures.

9C084B9C1FBB4CE6A21170262EEB00D3.description: Record (e.g., drawings, video) common athletic movements and identify bones and joints involved and anatomical movement represented.

1A759334F22D4B57AF8BB943EEFD23B1.description: Develop an action plan to help the elderly prevent bone density loss.

98AE5DA92DD046A1A75C89118C419F7D.description: Research gender and age data for common fractures. Discuss patterns that emerge. Develop explanations for common injuries for given age/gender classifications.

8F12CD9AECEF496F8C842CAA39877743.description: Create a model of each type of bone and identify features.

973D8C77008945FD98F3B861B1E13CE0.description: Measure femur length and perform associated calculations to find height. Graph results to compare genders and ages.

5447B2EBB0CD41E395F911FD295DE523.description: Compare bone structures in various vertebrates. Associate the structure of bones with their function (e.g., hollow bones in birds, fused radioulna in frogs). Dissection (e.g., chicken legs, pigs, cats) can be used as a point of comparison.

928B1E59716D478A9F3725C4504E5EEE.description: Design a system to analyze movement/joint stability in specified movements.

DC9A87BBA6324C7484B1B7A37B7BD576.description: Design a better cast for fractures, identifying the materials, type of fixation, etc.

0D44730C9732428A96735CA4933CA8D2.description: Design a bone model with cardstock and tape to meet specific parameters (e.g., strength). Test how well the model meets the parameters.

5168668450F94AB890FBF4A07C95391D.description: Design and create a model of a prosthetic limb that can a perform a task (e.g., lift or carry an object).

48E454624DF54CE496EE8B378D159328.description: Explain the cause of homeostatic imbalances (e.g., burns, skin cancers, anhidrosis, acne, eczema, scleroderma).

04AE5A28E40B4300831456F743FD6FD3.description: Explain how UV light from sun or tanning salon exposure increases the risks of skin cancer.

3419F316C6C2477A8DE22AC70A833E68.description: List sensory structures in the integumentary system.

F06924CA6AE54C5F8107197793C77860.description: Describe what attributes need to be considered in order to be a tissue donor.

0298786607254BA2ADDCDE4A1A6F4961.description: Describe the process of tissue engineering and tissue donation.

4979BA470D8A45B993C0E4FDD0FD5A41.description: Use microscopes, micrographs, models or illustrations to identify types of skin cells and accessory structures.

AB07496B37A3497197C53AC05ECE9FA6.description: Dispel myths about acne with knowledge about homeostatic imbalances in the integumentary system.

B3FF77D03DCA4B0CACB31540FF27DCC2.description: Explore the safety of tanning salons and alternative tanning methods (e.g., spray tanning).

4A9E76A67F6C425F9F0D3C5B075C44BC.description: Propose a plan to lower the incidence of skin cancer.

DE2CF4340E84451482F5614FE45878CE.description: Create a presentation or infographic to inform an audience about the risks of, and dispel common myths about, UV exposure.

374E44484243425FB960CB0290CBC4EF.description: Investigate and present data on the connection between UV/sun exposure and increased incidence of skin cancer.

A8C9276B415B47D998A7F500C907F777.description: Explore the connection between types of cells, accessory structures, and the ability to sense temperature and pressure.

397B5F1BD0974B4CB2B2193EF9A18FC3.description: Compare the structure and function of the integument of the major classes of vertebrates.

0DA1CD02BD0242A2A75B3FCC14739112.description: Create labeled illustrations or models of skin cells and accessory structures.

C2B654886C62464F89E817763B67686D.description: Design an investigation to compare various sunscreens and homeopathic methods using UV sensitive paper or UV sensitive yeast strains.

5B2A84727DA2450C89B9AAD8D645CEF9.description: Design a sunscreen that does not kill aquatic wildlife (e.g. corals).

9DB5609E8CCB4E02AC80A63559C21944.description: Label a diagram of a human body with directional terms, planes and cavities.

73741714F09F4AAA9C625ED59FD2E172.description: Demonstrate knowledge of anatomical directional terminology through the dissection of a three-dimensional object, such as a clay model, doll or gummy bear.

B98C4CA351284E4DB5145A2A17C1F0CC.description: Differentiate between positive and negative feedback mechanisms.

A3E56D83A5C94B28BC5458456EEFFCF9.description: Identify examples of how the body uses homeostasis to maintain balance.

260BE1F6C4034FFD9883017165FD4DBF.description: Investigate ways that prions, viruses, bacteria, protozoans and multicellular parasites disturb homeostasis. Give examples of diseases caused by each category.

1BD955029C9449949DC05689F0D48D1D.description: Research the chronic changes in the muscular, circulatory, and respiratory systems in response to starting an exercise program. Distinguish which kinds of changes result from which kinds of exercise (e.g., aerobic, anaerobic).

F829467DCBC34394A544B8E3E4CF1C7E.description: After using a simulation or another data source, discuss how the data are similar to and different from the self-regulation that goes on in an actual human body.

70E3F72AF32F4D8D8031FC75ECA80A71.description: Investigate homeostasis by measuring changes in heart rate. Compare resting heart rate to the rate after changing a variable. Present data and hypothesize ways to improve heart rates in stressed individuals (e.g., yoga, deep breathing).

FCFA4BDEE0E448F0AAE084D230C19AD1.description: Design or critique a device used to maintain or monitor homeostasis for a human body process (e.g., heart rate, glucose, oxygen level).

FF8EEE60531C4EB5B9B0121E793CAD54.description: Create labeled illustrations or models of the four types of human tissues.

7EB31739C67340168353DEEF92F1F70F.description: Use microscopes or virtual images to examine various tissues. Compare a range of epithelial (e.g., squamous, columnar, cuboidal), connective (e.g., cartilage, bone, blood), muscular (e.g., skeletal, cardiac, smooth) and nervous tissues. Interpret how the function of each tissue type relates to its structure.

E8420BBB9EA54D7FA646B6AC2FF1340B.description: Simulate tissue engineering using a variety of materials (e.g., gelatin, agar, yeast). Critique the characteristics of each tissue simulation to rate its possible use in tissue grafting.

84D870D963FA412185B938EF1124AF29.description: Identify the levels of organization from cellular to organism.

A26690ED7CE74A43951FE1B523510B84.description: Analyze data about various human cell types and hypothesize the relationships between structure and function.

503F1AA57C7649BD8E59BC3F34F3B267.description: Research various species of organisms that have been studied in order to understand fundamental physiological processes in humans. Explain the considerations in determining what species is the best to study for a particular process.
